ygData.subject: Re: swimming in the ocean
ygData.msgSnippet: I didn t run into any.  But there are sharks, aqua gobling, zombie sailors, all depending on area. ... From: Mata  To:
ygData.messageBody:
I didn't run into any. But there are sharks, aqua gobling, zombie sailors,
all depending on area.
----- Original Message -----
From: Mata <mata_eq@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 11:27 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: swimming in the ocean


> From: "Mata" <mata_eq@...>
>
> Can you be more specific as to the "dangers" you ran into?
>
> :-) Thanks!
> -Mata
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: John Cuyle <johncuyle@...>
> To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 2:19 PM
> Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: swimming in the ocean
>
>
> > From: "John Cuyle" <johncuyle@...>
> >
> > After having swam almost the entire ocean of tears (from the first
island
> on
> > the BB side to the last island on the Freeport side) I can say that
there
> > is some danger, but not a whole lot. I wouldn't suggest it as something
> to
> > do regularly, though.
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Mata <mata_eq@...>
> > To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
> > Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 10:25 AM
> > Subject: [eq_wizards] swimming in the ocean
> >
> >
> > > From: "Mata" <mata_eq@...>
> > >
> > > How dangerous is it to swim in the ocean, are there sharks or
> > anything??
> > > If you die you loose EVERTHING! and good luck finding your body. At
> least
> > > that is what I heard . . . anybody??
> > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > From: Donald Taber <dtaber@...>
> > > To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
> > > Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 12:59 PM
> > > Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: ** SPOILER ** Help with Human Wiz Quests
> > >
> > >
> > > > From: Donald Taber <dtaber@...>
> > > >
> > > > Thanks for the info on Lydl. I assume he is in the East Freeport
zone
> > and
> > > not
> > > >
> > > > North Ro?
> > > >
> > > > I haven't found the locked box. I made the same mistake thinking
you
> > > could
> > > > swim to the island, but after re-reading the info you are given, I
> > believe
> > > you
> > > > have
> > > > to take the boat out. I have taken the boat out to the first island
> > stop,
> > > > searched
> > > > and found nothing. I also made it to the second stop, searched and
> > found
> > > > nothing.
> > > > I had to stop playing at this point, but I understand there is one
> more
> > > island
> > > > stop
> > > > (it was my first trip on the boat). Let me know if you find it or
get
> > any
> > > > more
> > > > information.
> > > >
> > > > On the bright side, my swimming skill is pretty high now!
> > > >
> > > >
> > > Thanks
> > > > again,
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > Soren
> > > >
> > > > Billy Sun wrote:
> > > >
> > > > > From: "Billy Sun" <bsun@...>
> > > > >
> > > > > Lydl Mastat is near the East Freeport. He walks around between
1pm
> to
> > > 7pm
> > > > > game time. In regard to the second quest, where did you find the
> > locked
> > > > > box? I swam across but find nothing.
> > > > >

> > > > > >

> > > > > >
> > > > > > 1. Find Lydl Mastat outside of Freeport and get the locked book
> > from
> > > > > > him.
> > > > > > I have tried to find him out both gates, in North Ro, and in
East
> > > > > > Commanlands
> > > > > > and can't find him. Where is he? Does he only appear at
certain
> > > > > > times? I
> > > > > > have looked MANY times and can't find him.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 2. Get the locked strongbox back. I have found that the box is
> on
> > an
> > > > > > island
> > > > > > which is straight out from the docks. Is it possible to swim
> there
> > or
> > > > > > do I need
> > > > > > a boat?
> > > > > >
